channel.title: I cannot portforward
channel.description: Yeah i can give you my type of router, i tried opening my 43945 port and it doesn't work, i used like 30 differnet tutorials that showed me all the same thing.... I have good coding skills i just dunt know how to open my damn port! lol please help me someone.

item.title: I cannot portforward
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

43594 is what almost all servers use, You have to make sure that your firewall will allow incoming requests from that port, meaning if you didn’t add an exception to the port no one will be able to get by your firewall, just hit property’s on your firewall button…

For the router you just need to log onto it through the web, it is usually something like http://192.168.1.1, or http://192.168.1.2. You will then need to add an exception to your router in your port forward/ trigger section of your routers online configuration site.

Read full topic

item.title: I cannot portforward
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

Are you sure that’s your correct port? I’m not sure because it’s so similar to the ones that nearly everyone uses, 43594. You put down 43945.

Read full topic
